lead_paragraph: Kentucky is the first state to abandon a homegrown insurance exchange that works well, and residents will need to use the federal HealthCare.gov exchange.
snippet: Kentucky is the first state to abandon a homegrown insurance exchange that works well, and residents will need to use the federal HealthCare.gov exchange.

headline.main: With Health Care Switch, Kentucky Ventures Into the Unknown
headline.print_headline: In Kentucky, Abandoning Health Plan Sows Doubts

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

abstract: Kentucky Gov Matt Bevin formally announces to Obama administration he intends to shut down health insurance exchange that enrolls residents for coverage under Affordable Care Act, becoming first state to shut down exchange that functions well; administration promises to help transfer those enrolled to federal exchange, but some worry about negative effects of move.
